Based on the provided context, it appears that the second study, phs000974, involves the Framingham Heart Study. This study is a prospective cohort study of 3 generations of subjects who have been followed up to 65 years to evaluate risk factors for cardiovascular disease. The study includes DNA samples from approximately 8,000 participants in 10,000 families, which were collected and immortalized since the mid-1990s. The Framingham Heart Study is a well-known longitudinal study that has contributed significantly to our understanding of cardiovascular disease risk factors and outcomes.
